page.title: 14CLOPTONS SOCIAL LIFE
page.content: Clopton has no social clubs for adults or children. Children wishing to join cubs, scouts or brownies etc., must travel to Grundisburgh. Likewise the ladies wishing to join a club or Womens Institute can join Grundisburgh W.I. or one of the villages' clubs. For evening or adult education classes there are good schools at Kesgrave Adult centre or Suffolk College of F.H.E. There are no sports or recreational facilities in the village, however there is a Bowls Club at nearby Otley with its own Bowling Green. Some children also have their own horses stabled locally. Clopton does have a public house called The Clopton Crown.
